creator: clamey@infonow.com
text:
1) Create a Context for a web app with at least one subdirectory in it.
2) Try to access the webapp

Tomcat won't be able to find the generated classfile and will throw back a 404
to the client.

Here's an example:

http://mikal.org/interests/java/tomcat/archive/view?mesg=40892

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
The problem is that URLClassLoader has problems with directory names containing
%2F, or possibly encoded characters in general.  As a result, it would return
null when getResourceAsStream() was called open a stream to the class file.

The fix appears in the current 3.3 nightly and will be included in RC2.  Reopen
if you still have problems.

Thanks for the bug report.
